intro: Lepidium mossii, commonly known as the mossy peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Lepidium mossii typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
